WRITING.TITLE: Am I Shadowbanned?

WRITING.TEXT: Don't waste your time with greedy fucks like Autodesk. There software is hard to use and you will get an error even when you do the most simplest thing. He'll need experience with programming. Modo sucks ass. Start with blender, have him learn cycles rendering. Then, he should move to maya. If he's looking for games, use unity or cry engine. Unreal lags like hell.

WRITING.TITLE: Any advice for mocapping a dog? Should I go the old school way and just put one of my old mocap suits on her? Or is it possible to do it with an Xbox kinect?
WRITING.TEXT: Basically I have this cgi cyborg suit looking thing, and I need Brooklynn(The dog's name) to wear it. So, I'm gonna mocap her on set, take her mocap data into maya, animate the suit with the mocap data, and then bring the shot of the doge into AE plus the rendered shot of the cyborg suit and composite it onto the dog. Is there any other efficient way to do this? Any tips? Has anyone ever mocapped a quadruped before? Pic related, Brooklynn: http://m.imgur.com/z0g5ooK
And where is a tutorial for the new mecanim system?

WRITING.TITLE: How do I add animation to enemy characters in Unity? It feels like no tutorial or script is working with Unity 5. Please help! I need the enemy to play a walking animation when his speed is greater than .1, and then go back to idle if his speed is less than .1!

At 9:46 of this tutorial, this man uses a script called enemy_with_animation, its an ai script with two boxes where one drag and drops the idle and walk animations. no mecanim required. where do i find or make this script?

im getting beyond frustrated. I had a tutorial which said in order for animations to transition in mechanim, you are to set the conditions to speed. only in unity 5, in the conditions box, it says "Parameter does not exist." its almost as frustrating as using cryengine!
Happened a while ago. Received an interesting package. Apparently, I am now a Transhumanist crusader...

WRITING.TEXT: I simply don't want it to rotate 360 degrees around me. I want it to walk towards me. I tried adding a rigid body, and freezing the x and z rotations. Doesn't work. Tried adding a character controller, didnt work.

WRITING.TITLE: Will Source 2 get rid of the shitty .mdl compile system? Will we be able to import .fbx?
WRITING.TEXT: Let's face it. Source 1 is a pain. Compiling mdl is horrendous. Half Life 2's normalmaps/bump maps are so shitty. What improvements will be in source 2?

WRITING.TITLE: I'm creating AI, however, when I create a rigid body component, the npc moves towards me, leans backwards, walks into me, and finally spins on the floor in 360 degrees. Reminds me of a seizure. What do I do? Code I used is in this tutorials description:

[WP] Fascist transhuman forces occupy earth via a Third World War. You are a captured resistance leader sentenced to die, but you are given a chance of freedom: help the transhumanists create a master race by ridding the world of all minorities. Do you accept this ultimatum?

Fascist transhuman forces occupy earth via a Third World War. You are a captured resistance leader sentenced to die, but you are given a chance of freedom: help the transhumanists create a master race by ridding the world of all minorities. Do you accept this ultimatum?

Hi r/guns, I know this might be a spam question, but what is the most powerful sniper rifle in the world? I have this strange fascination with them. You know? It feels good to aim down the sights knowing you have incredible power with pinpoint accuracy.
Reddit, I don't think I can go on for much longer. It's so hard. I'm running track, but I lose a lot. 4th place in hurdles. You'd think that's good, but no I get compared to my cousins...
WRITING.TEXT: I've had enough. This has gone on forever. I will never be good enough. Plus my dad called me a dick and always yells. I find refuge in creating levels and unity 5. I bake textures in Blender cycles and then send it to unity so the graphics look like fucking Gravity. It's amazing. I thought my family would be proud. But no. My family said I spent too much time online, which I felt was a fucking erroneous assumption, since I only worked on the project for 30 minutes each day before going outside and trying to please everyone in track. It's killing me. I can't go on much longer.

WRITING.TITLE: So, I've modeled a hallway in blender and exported it. Only thing is, when I use a first person controller, the hallway is invisible. Same thing in scene mode, If I fly around outside, everything looks great, but if I fly inside, everything is invisible?
WRITING.TEXT: Please help. Newbie from CryEngine here.

WRITING.TITLE: is it possible to make the blender game engine look as good as UE4?

WRITING.TITLE: I'm doing this massive battle scene. I'm talking huge. As in thousands of soldiers. Planetside 2 stuff mothafuckas. Should I do this as an AI battle, or as a pre-animated/scripted scene? How do I do this comrades?

WRITING.TITLE: Modding for le glorious pc exclusive physics sandbox gmod. Where do I go to find the folder for Half Life 2 models and materials? I go to Steam/steamapps/common/Half-Life 2/hl2/models but there are only 6 models, those being weapons. What do I do?
WRITING.TEXT: I dont have the username folder in steamapps, I guess thats part of the steampipe update. Anyway, I need to find the Half-Life 2 materials and models folder so the faceposer and model viewer can easily find and present my models with texture.

WRITING.TITLE: Where do I go to find the assets such as models and materials folders for Half life 2 and Team Fortress 2? My steamapps has no username folder like all the modding tutorials do. So where do I go to find all the models, assets, and materials?

WRITING.TITLE: I'm exporting animation to cryengine. Can I bake armature keyframe poses into regular LocRotScale/shape keys so blender thinks it's hardbody animation?
WRITING.TEXT: Seriously. Cryengine can't read cryblends cfg or armature files. So don't try. Please, I just want to know how to bake armature poses into hardbody poses.
